summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York regarding a defense motion in limine (MIL 4) concerning the exclusion of evidence related to 'Accuser-3'. The prosecutor suggests discussing the response, noting the issue was previously briefed as a pretrial motion.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, working in the Southern District of New York, seeking to coordinate a response to a defense motion in limine.

events.title: Email Regarding Defense Motion in Limine 4
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney sends an email to discuss how to respond to a defense motion to exclude evidence related to 'Accuser-3'.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated October 19, 2021, concerning legal strategy in an Epstein-related case.
It references 'Defense MIL 4', a motion in limine filed by the defense seeking to exclude evidence related to an individual labeled 'Accuser-3'.
The prosecutor notes the issue was previously briefed as a pretrial motion, indicating ongoing litigation.
The correspondence originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
